result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert T Boyce Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).
  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

superMiscConds.notes: AS TO COUNTS ONE AND TWO:  same conditions as probation conditions, exception is the condition time.

supervisions.notes: REVIEW hearing January 22, 2016 at 8:30 a.m. in Br. 30.

miscConds.notes: Pay the DNA surcharge, costs and disbursements after the $1,000.00 payment, by the end of Extended Supervision.  If not paid, wil convert to civil judgment.
Seek and maintain full time employment.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms; also advised that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election  until his civil rights are restored.

Pay continuing child support and pay on arrears.
$1,000.00 payment towards child support by January 13, 2016.

timeConds.notes:
STAYED to be used at the Court's and Department's discretion.
*7/24/2017  To serve 50 days.  Straight time.  No good time credit.  Order for Commitment signed/filed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert T Boyce Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Signed, Filed, and Distributed; Order for commitment for condition time for non-compliance with probation conditions. Commitment ordered forthwith, 50 days straight time, with no good time credit.

Pursuant to current District Court Rules, this case is assigned and 
forwarded to Judge Colon for review. os

Received from the Department of Corrections - Probation, request to:
[    ]   Extend Probation
[    ]   Set Restitution
[    ]   Remove Court Obligations
[ X ]   Review / Modify Probation
[    ]   Convert Unpaid Obligations to Civil Judgment

Defendant Robert T Boyce in court with Attorney Chris Bailey.  Defendant Robert T Boyce in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Brooke Gagliano appears for the Department of Corrections.

Matter here for a Review Hearing.  The Defendant has made all payments ordered by the Court.  The Department of Corrections is withdrawing their request for additional commitment time.  No other action taken.  The Defendant is to be released from custody.  The Court indicated that once Defendant is employed, he needs to have a wage assignment in place.
Deputy Court Clerk tg

Pursuant to current District Court Rules, this case is assigned and 
forwarded to Judge Conen
for review. os

Received from the Department of Corrections - Probation, request to:
[    ]   Extend Probation
[    ]   Set Restitution
[    ]   Remove Court Obligations
[ x  ]   Review / Modify Probation
[    ]   Convert Unpaid Obligations to Civil Judgment

Defendant Robert T Boyce in court with Attorney Chris Bailey.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Brooke Gagliano appeared for the Department of Corrections.

Matter here for a review hearing.  The Defendant has only paid $100.  The Court adomonished the Defendant and gave him 30 days to make an additional payment of $900 or the stay will be lifted.  Matter set for a review hearing on February 22, 2016 at 8:30am in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.
Deputy Court Clerk tg

FILED, Court Memo
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Robert T Boyce in court with Attorney Chris Bailey.  Benjamin Andr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a Plea Hearing.  The State indicated no wage assignment was in effect.  The Defendant indicated he just started a new job.  The Court ORDERED a wage assignment be put in place with Defendant's employer TODAY.  The Defendant is to produce a copy to the Court indicating that the wage assignment was filed TODAY at the sentencing hearing.  If not, that will be taken into account at sentencing.  Sworn for the State:  Jeanetta C.  

AS TO COUNT #1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.

AS TO COUNT #2:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Matter is set for sentencing on December 1, 2015 at 1:30pm in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.
Deputy Court Clerk tg
Milwaukee County Pretrial Services Violation Report (missed telephone contact), received and filed.
Milwaukee County Pretrial Services Violation Report (missed telephone contact) received and filed.

Defendant Robert T Boyce in court with attorney Chris Bailey.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Status conference held.  Parties engaged in negotiations.  Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.  The Court grants defense request for 60 day adjournment with the understanding that the court will not grant any further adjournments of the plea hearing.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.

Defendant Robert T Boyce in court with Attorney Chris Bailey.  Joanne L Hardtke for Maureen Ami Atwell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial before Judge Conen, Branch 30. Original Information, received and filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant plead not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned to September 2, 2015 at 8:30am for a status/scheduling conference.

FILED, Justice Point Pretrial Report.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.    Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Robert T Boyce in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Robert T Boyce in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.    All parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 case will be assigned to Judge Conen, Branch 30 in Room 635 of the Courthouse.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Robert T Boyce not in court.  Anthony E. White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 06-22-2015 at 01:30p,
